summary: This document is a court opinion regarding a petition by L.A.W. Limitless, LLC to compel arbitration in a contractual dispute with Fr. Lurssen Werft (GMBH & Co.) over the construction of a yacht. The court ruled in favor of L.A.W., stating that the failure to designate an arbitrator within a specified time frame did not waive the right to arbitration, and appointed an arbitrator to resolve the disputes.

persons.name: Darren K Indyke
persons.context: Darren K Indyke provided an affidavit dated November 30, 1998, related to the arbitration dispute between L.A.W. Limitless, LLC and Fr. Lurssen Werft.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein was the original contractor for the yacht construction, and the agreement was later assigned to L.A.W. Limitless, LLC.

persons.name: Michael M. Gordon
persons.context: Michael M. Gordon represented L.A.W. Limitless, LLC in the arbitration petition.

persons.name: Glen T. Donon
persons.context: Glen T. Donon represented Fr. Lurssen Werft in the arbitration dispute.

persons.name: Jed S. Rakoff
persons.context: Jed S. Rakoff presided over the case and issued the opinion granting the petition to compel arbitration.

connections.description: Darren K Indyke was involved in the contractual matters related to the yacht construction originally contracted by Jeffrey Epstein.
Darren K Indyke provided an affidavit in a case where Michael M. Gordon represented L.A.W. Limitless, LLC.
Michael M. Gordon represented L.A.W. Limitless, LLC in front of Judge Jed S. Rakoff.
Glen T. Donon represented Fr. Lurssen Werft in front of Judge Jed S. Rakoff.

events.title: Court Opinion on Arbitration
events.description: The court granted L.A.W. Limitless, LLC's petition to compel arbitration regarding a yacht construction dispute with Fr. Lurssen Werft.

keyFacts: Darren K Indyke provided an affidavit in the arbitration case.
Jeffrey Epstein was the original contractor for the yacht construction.
The court ruled that failure to designate an arbitrator within a specified time did not waive the right to arbitration.
Judge Jed S. Rakoff presided over the case and appointed an arbitrator.
Michael M. Gordon represented L.A.W. Limitless, LLC in the arbitration petition.
